CONFLICT.Definition: fight or struggle between people or groups

UNJUSTIFIABLE.Definition: not able to be defended or explained as fair or reasonable

FOG.Definition: a thick cloud of tiny water droplets, making it hard to see

OVERLOOKING.Definition: looking out over them from a higher place

TOWERING.Definition: standing very tall and high above everything around it

WARRING.Definition: involved in a conflict or fighting

ARTEFACT.Definition: an object of historical interest, made by humans

CONQUEST.Definition: the act of taking control of a country or land by force

DOMINANCE.Definition: being in control or having power over it

HERETICAL.Definition: involving ideas or beliefs that went against accepted religion teachings

HOTBED.Definition: a place with a lot of activity

CEMENT.Definition: make it stronger or more solid

SETTLE.Definition: move there and make it their home

PLANTATION.Definition: a large farm where crops were grown

FERTILE.Definition: able to produce a lot of crops or plants

SETTLERS.Definition: people who would move to the new area to live there

ARABLE.Definition: land that was suitable for growing crops

GUERRILLA.Definition: involving fighters who used surprise attacks and not regular army tactics

TEND.Definition: regularly or frequently behave in a particular way

EXCEPTIONS.Definition: situations that were not included in the general rule

DISCLAIMERS.Definition: statements that say something may not apply

IRRITATING.Definition: annoying or making you slightly angry

MARGINALISED.Definition: pushed to the edge of society, made to seem unimportant

RECOURSE.Definition: a way of getting help or solving a problem

SYNONYM.Definition: a word that has the same or nearly the same meaning as another word

FLASHPOINTS.Definition: places or events where conflict was likely to happen

DEEP-SEATED.Definition: strongly felt or believed for a long time

DISCRIMINATION.Definition: unfair treatment because of their religion

BAN.Definition: officially or legally prohibit or forbid

HEAVY-HANDED.Definition: using too much force or being very strict

TENSIONS.Definition: feelings of stress, worry, or unease between people

RESTORE.Definition: bring back or return it to how it was before

DORMANT.Definition: inactive but capable of becoming active later

PARAMILITARY.Definition: organised like an army but not part of the official military

IDEOLOGICAL.Definition: based on a set of beliefs or ideas

LINES.Definition: groups divided by beliefs or ideas

WING.Definition: section or part of the group

SECTARIAN.Definition: related to strong support for a particular group

PEAK.Definition: highest point of presence or activity

VOLATILE.Definition: likely to change quickly or become dangerous

ENTRENCHED.Definition: firmly established and difficult to change

STAGGERING.Definition: very surprising, shocking, or hard to believe

TIT-FOR-TAT.Definition: an action done in revenge for another one

BOMB SCARES.Definition: false alarms or threats of bombs

HUNGER STRIKES.Definition: a protest where people refused to eat

TRANSPIRE.Definition: become known or come to light

HUNGER STRIKE.Definition: refusing to eat as a form of protest

BY-ELECTION.Definition: a special election to fill a position that had become empty before the next regular election

CAUSE.Definition: idea or movement that they fought for

COMPROMISES.Definition: agreements where each side gave up something

SPLINTER GROUP.Definition: a smaller group that had broken away from the main one

DISGUST.Definition: a strong feeling of dislike or anger

SEGREGATION.Definition: keeping people apart based on differences

MURALS.Definition: large paintings or artwork on walls

BRANDISHING.Definition: holding or waving in a threatening way
